Function

Methods

(static) applyToFunc(item, expression)

Source:
  • method/applyToFunc.js, line 13

Helper for pipeline. Passes 'item' into 'expression' as its first argument.
Expression may be a function or an array of form: [function, ...remainingArguments].

Parameters:
Name Type Description
item *
expression *

(static) checkCall(method, params) → {*}

Source:
  • method/checkCall.js, line 15

Check if the passed in method is a function, and calls it

Example
checkCall((param1) => { return param1 }, 'foo')
// Returns 'foo'
Parameters:
Name Type Description
method function

function to call
params Object

params to pass to the method on call
Returns:
  • whatever the passed in method returns
Type
*

(static) cloneFunc(func) → {Object}

Source:
  • method/cloneFunc.js, line 16

Clones a function using the Function constructor and calling toString on the passed in function

Example
const func = () => { console.log('test') }
const clone = cloneFunc(func)
// clone !== func
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

function to clone
Returns:

cloned function

Type
Object

(static) compareTo(x, y) → {number|null}

Source:
  • method/compareTo.js, line 14

Generic compare to method that works for strings, numbers, and booleans

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x string | number | boolean
y string | number | boolean
Returns:
  • returns a value < 0 if x is less than y, 0 if they are equal, and a value greater than 0 if x is greater than y. Returns null if the args are not comparable.
Type
number | null

(static) complement(predicate) → (nullable) {function}

Source:
  • method/complement.js, line 16

Returns a new function that is the complement of predicate function predicate

Example
const isNegative = x => (x < 0)
const isNonNegative = complement(isNegative)
isNonNegative(1) // true
Parameters:
Name Type Description
predicate function
Returns:

the complement of predicate, if it's a function, otherwise null

Type
function

(static) debounce(func, wait, immediate) → {void}

Source:
  • method/debounce.js, line 22

Limits the amount of calls to a function over time

Examples
debounce(myFunction)
// Calls myFunction after the default 250 ms
debounce(myFunction, 500)
// Calls myFunction after 500 ms
debounce(myFunction, 500, true)
// Calls myFunction immediately
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

function to call
wait Number

how long to wait between function calls
immediate Boolean

should call immediately
Returns:
Type
void

(static) doIt() → {void}

Source:
  • method/doIt.js, line 19

Execute a method n times.
Callback params - does not include number || callback method

Examples
doIt(10, window, [], (index, arr) => { arr.push(index) }) === [ 0,1,2 ... 8,9 ]
doIt(10, () => console.log(`Hello`)) // Logs `Hello` 10 times
Parameters:
Name Type Description
args.0 Number

number of times to call the callback
args.1 parent

value to bind the method call to ( this )
args.last function

arg of args array - method to call
Returns:
Type
void

(static) eitherFunc(func1, func2) → {function}

Source:
  • method/eitherFunc.js, line 19

Returns the first param if it's a function.
If first param is not a function, returns second param.

Examples
eitherFunc(() => {}, 'bar')
// Returns first param because it's a function.
eitherFunc('foo', 'bar')
// Returns 'bar'
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func1 function

return if is func
func2 function

use if first is not an object
Returns:
Type
function

(static) identity(x) → {*}

Source:
  • method/identity.js, line 9

A function that simply returns its input

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x *
Returns:

the input

Type
*

(static) isFunc(test) → {Boolean}

Source:
  • method/isFunc.js, line 15

Check if the passed in item is a function.

Examples
isFunc(() => {})
// Returns true
isFunc('bar')
// Returns false
Parameters:
Name Type Description
test *
Returns:

is a function

Type
Boolean

(static) isOrderable(x) → {bool}

Source:
  • method/isOrderable.js, line 13

Checks if param is an orderable primitive

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x *
Returns:
  • true if x is a comparable primitive
Type
bool

(static) limbo(promise, asObjectopt) → {Promise.<TLimboResponse>}

Source:
  • method/limbo.js, line 28

Adds catch to a promise for better error handling of await functions
Removes the need for wrapping await in a try / catch
First argument is an Error when the promise throws or null when it resolves
Second argument is the response from the resolved promise

Example
const [ err, data ] = await limbo(promiseFunction())
// returns an array
// * err will be undefined if no error was thrown
// * data will be the response from the promiseFunction
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
promise Promise.<function()>

Promise to be resolved
asObject boolean <optional>
 false

2nd argument in resp array should be an object when an error is caught
Returns:
  • Slot 1 => error, Slot 2 => response from promise
Type
Promise.<TLimboResponse>

(static) limboify(cb, args) → {Promise|*}

Source:
  • method/limbo.js, line 51

Converts a method with a callback as the last argument into a promise

Examples
limboify(fs.rename, 'my/file.txt', 'my/renamed-file.txt')
limboify(fs.mkdir, 'my/new/directory', { recursive: true })
Parameters:
Name Type Description
cb *

method to wrap in a promise
args *

Arguments to pass to the callback method
Returns:
  • Success response of fs.rename method
Type
Promise | *

(static) match(matchArg, entries) → {*}

Source:
  • method/match.js, line 51

Pattern matching function. Iterates through the entries,
which have the form [ check value or predicate, return value ], and
when it encounters an entry whose check value matches the matchArg
(or the predicate returns true when passed the matchArg), it returns
the return value of that entry.

For the default case: use [ match.default, ]

Examples
const value = 1
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
 [ match.default, "defaulted"]
)
=> returns "hello"
const value = 3
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
)
=> returns "greater"
// react reducer:
function todoReducer(state, action) {
  const reducer = match(action.type,
      [ 'ADD-TODO', addTodo ],
      [ 'REMOVE-TODO', removeTodo ],
      [ 'UPDATE-TODO', updateTodo ],
      [ match.default, state ]
  )

  return reducer(state, action)
}
Parameters:
Name Type Description
matchArg *

the argument to match against the cases
entries Array

the cases to match against the matchArg
Returns:
  • the return value of the first entry with a matching check value, else null
Type
*

(static) memorize(func, getCacheKey) → {function}

Source:
  • method/memorize.js, line 19

Creates a method to memorize passed in methods output

Examples
memorize(myFunction, cacheKeyFunction)
memorize(myFunction, cacheKeyFunction, 100)
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

method to memorize output of
getCacheKey function

gets the key to save cached output
Returns:

memorized function with cache

Type
function

(static) noOp() → {void}

Source:
  • method/noOp.js, line 8

Reusable empty function that is a no-op

Returns:
Type
void

(static) not(func) → {function}

Source:
  • method/not.js, line 56

When called, it calls original function, then returns inverse of the functions result
Should be used with functions that return a boolean

Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

Function call and invert its response
Returns:
  • Calls the passed in function then returns True if the passed in function returns falsy, otherwise false
Type
function

(static) parseErrorMessage(exception) → (nullable) {string}

Source:
  • method/parseErrorMessage.js, line 20

Extracts the message from the exception, whether string or object

Example
try {
  throwSomeException()
}
catch (err) {
  const message = parseErrorMessage(err) || 'Error'
}
Parameters:
Name Type Description
exception *

Error to be extracted
Returns:
  • The message or null if no message is present
Type
string

(static) pipeline(item, …functions) → {*}

Source:
  • method/pipeline.js, line 16

Function for making repeated nested function calls (the 'pipeline') succinct. Passes "item" into
the first function (as its first argument), takes its result and passes that into the next function, and repeats.
Continues until no functions remain, at which point it returns the value returned by the last function.
- you can also pass in an array in place of a function to specify a function to be called with some arguments. E.g.: [foo, 2, 3] would return foo(item, 2, 3)

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
item *

the starting input. If it is a function, it will be executed immediately and the result will be piped into the remaining functions.
functions function <repeatable>

Functions to be iterated over one after the other
Returns:
  • the final result of calling the pipeline of functions , starting with item as input
Type
*

(static) runSeq(asyncFns) → {Promise.<Array.<*>>}

Source:
  • method/runSeq.js, line 29

Calls each promise-returning function in array asyncFns, but awaits each before calling the next. Will pass the index and resolved values of complete functions to each subsequent function, in case any need them.

Examples
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions)
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions, { cloneResults: true, returnOriginal: false })
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
asyncFns Array.<function()>

array of functions to call in sequence. Each will be passed (currentIndex, resultsSoFar)
options.cloneResults boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 false

if true, each function will be passed a deep clone of the results array, rather than the reference to it.
options.returnOriginal boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 true

if true, any member of asyncFns that is not a function will have its corresponding value in the return array be itself. If this is false, that value will be undefined.
Returns:
  • returns a promise that resolves to an array of all the asyncFns' return values
Type
Promise.<Array.<*>>

(static) stackTracePaths(filter) → {Array.<string>}

Source:
  • method/stackTracePaths.js, line 14

Gets the paths from a stacktrace as CallSites and returns them

Parameters:
Name Type Description
filter Array | function

List of paths to ignore, or function that returns truthy to ignore
Returns:
  • List of paths from the stackTrace
Type
Array.<string>

(static) throttle(func, waitopt) → {function}

Source:
  • method/throttle.js, line 12

Throttle function calls to only execute once over a wait period

Example
throttle(() => console.log('throttled'), 50)()
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
func *

method to call after wait
wait Number <optional>
 100

time to wait between calls
Returns:

throttled function

Type
function

(static) throttleLast(func, cb, waitopt) → {function}

Source:
  • method/throttleLast.js, line 19

Ensures the last call to the throttled function get called.
Will wait the allotted time, before calling the last call to it.
The final call will not execute until no more calls are made,
Accepts a callback to call each time the throttle called,

Example
throttleLast(() => {}, () => {})()
// throttle function
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
func function

method to call after wait
cb function

method to call after throttle function is called
wait Number <optional>
 100

time to wait until executing func param
Returns:

throttled function

Type
function

(static) throwError(error)

Source:
  • method/throwError.js, line 12

Throws an Error from the passed in error

Parameters:
Name Type Description
error Object | string

The Error message or Object to throw
Throws:

Error

(static) timedRun(fn, …argsnullable) → {Promise.<Array.<*, number>>}

Source:
  • method/timedRun.js, line 17

Executes and times the function fn.

Examples
const [ result, executionTime ] = timedRun(() => http.get(url)))
const [ result, executionTime ] = timedRun(http.get, url)
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
fn function
args * <nullable>
<repeatable>

any number of arguments to pass to fn when it is called
Returns:

[ fn output, execution time in ms ]

Type
Promise.<Array.<*, number>>

(static) uuid(startopt) → {String}

Source:
  • method/uuid.js, line 12

Creates a uuid, unique up to around 20 million iterations.

Example
uuid()
// New uuid as a string
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
start Number <optional>

of the uuid
Returns:
  • build uuid
Type
String

(static) waitForIt() → {Promise.<any>}

Source:
  • method/waitForIt.js, line 33

Waits for check method to return true before calling onFinish
Will call the passed in checkMethod x (amount) number of times before failing
Will wait x ( wait ) milliseconds between calls to the check method

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
args.check function

checks if onFinished should be called ( returns true )
args.onFinish function

called when check methods returns true
args.amount Number <optional>
 4

Amount of times to call the check before failing
args.wait Number <optional>
 1000

Time to wait between each check
...args Array <optional>

Arguments to pass to the check, and onFinish methods
Returns:
  • Resolves to the response from onFinish
Type
Promise.<any>

(static) match(matchArg, entries) → {*}

Source:
  • method/match.js, line 51

Pattern matching function. Iterates through the entries,
which have the form [ check value or predicate, return value ], and
when it encounters an entry whose check value matches the matchArg
(or the predicate returns true when passed the matchArg), it returns
the return value of that entry.

For the default case: use [ match.default, ]

Examples
const value = 1
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
 [ match.default, "defaulted"]
)
=> returns "hello"
const value = 3
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
)
=> returns "greater"
// react reducer:
function todoReducer(state, action) {
  const reducer = match(action.type,
      [ 'ADD-TODO', addTodo ],
      [ 'REMOVE-TODO', removeTodo ],
      [ 'UPDATE-TODO', updateTodo ],
      [ match.default, state ]
  )

  return reducer(state, action)
}
Parameters:
Name Type Description
matchArg *

the argument to match against the cases
entries Array

the cases to match against the matchArg
Returns:
  • the return value of the first entry with a matching check value, else null
Type
*

(static) pipeline(item, …functions) → {*}

Source:
  • method/pipeline.js, line 16

Function for making repeated nested function calls (the 'pipeline') succinct. Passes "item" into
the first function (as its first argument), takes its result and passes that into the next function, and repeats.
Continues until no functions remain, at which point it returns the value returned by the last function.
- you can also pass in an array in place of a function to specify a function to be called with some arguments. E.g.: [foo, 2, 3] would return foo(item, 2, 3)

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
item *

the starting input. If it is a function, it will be executed immediately and the result will be piped into the remaining functions.
functions function <repeatable>

Functions to be iterated over one after the other
Returns:
  • the final result of calling the pipeline of functions , starting with item as input
Type
*

(static) runSeq(asyncFns) → {Promise.<Array.<*>>}

Source:
  • method/runSeq.js, line 29

Calls each promise-returning function in array asyncFns, but awaits each before calling the next. Will pass the index and resolved values of complete functions to each subsequent function, in case any need them.

Examples
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions)
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions, { cloneResults: true, returnOriginal: false })
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
asyncFns Array.<function()>

array of functions to call in sequence. Each will be passed (currentIndex, resultsSoFar)
options.cloneResults boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 false

if true, each function will be passed a deep clone of the results array, rather than the reference to it.
options.returnOriginal boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 true

if true, any member of asyncFns that is not a function will have its corresponding value in the return array be itself. If this is false, that value will be undefined.
Returns:
  • returns a promise that resolves to an array of all the asyncFns' return values
Type
Promise.<Array.<*>>

(static) stackTracePaths(filter) → {Array.<string>}

Source:
  • method/stackTracePaths.js, line 14

Gets the paths from a stacktrace as CallSites and returns them

Parameters:
Name Type Description
filter Array | function

List of paths to ignore, or function that returns truthy to ignore
Returns:
  • List of paths from the stackTrace
Type
Array.<string>

(static) throttle(func, waitopt) → {function}

Source:
  • method/throttle.js, line 12

Throttle function calls to only execute once over a wait period

Example
throttle(() => console.log('throttled'), 50)()
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
func *

method to call after wait
wait Number <optional>
 100

time to wait between calls
Returns:

throttled function

Type
function

(static) throttleLast(func, cb, waitopt) → {function}

Source:
  • method/throttleLast.js, line 19

Ensures the last call to the throttled function get called.
Will wait the allotted time, before calling the last call to it.
The final call will not execute until no more calls are made,
Accepts a callback to call each time the throttle called,

Example
throttleLast(() => {}, () => {})()
// throttle function
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
func function

method to call after wait
cb function

method to call after throttle function is called
wait Number <optional>
 100

time to wait until executing func param
Returns:

throttled function

Type
function

Source:

(static) timedRun(fn, …argsnullable) → {Promise.<Array.<*, number>>}

Source:
  • method/timedRun.js, line 17

Executes and times the function fn.

Examples
const [ result, executionTime ] = timedRun(() => http.get(url)))
const [ result, executionTime ] = timedRun(http.get, url)
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
fn function
args * <nullable>
<repeatable>

any number of arguments to pass to fn when it is called
Returns:

[ fn output, execution time in ms ]

Type
Promise.<Array.<*, number>>

(static) waitForIt() → {Promise.<any>}

Source:
  • method/waitForIt.js, line 33

Waits for check method to return true before calling onFinish
Will call the passed in checkMethod x (amount) number of times before failing
Will wait x ( wait ) milliseconds between calls to the check method

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
args.check function

checks if onFinished should be called ( returns true )
args.onFinish function

called when check methods returns true
args.amount Number <optional>
 4

Amount of times to call the check before failing
args.wait Number <optional>
 1000

Time to wait between each check
...args Array <optional>

Arguments to pass to the check, and onFinish methods
Returns:
  • Resolves to the response from onFinish
Type
Promise.<any>

Check if the passed in method is a function, and calls it

Example
checkCall((param1) => { return param1 }, 'foo')
// Returns 'foo'
Parameters:
Name Type Description
method function

function to call
params Object

params to pass to the method on call
Returns:
  • whatever the passed in method returns

(static) cloneFunc(func) → {Object}

Source:
  • method/cloneFunc.js, line 16

Clones a function using the Function constructor and calling toString on the passed in function

Example
const func = () => { console.log('test') }
const clone = cloneFunc(func)
// clone !== func
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

function to clone
Returns:

cloned function

Type
Object

(static) compareTo(x, y) → {number|null}

Source:
  • method/compareTo.js, line 14

Generic compare to method that works for strings, numbers, and booleans

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x string | number | boolean
y string | number | boolean
Returns:
  • returns a value < 0 if x is less than y, 0 if they are equal, and a value greater than 0 if x is greater than y. Returns null if the args are not comparable.
Type
number | null

(static) complement(predicate) → (nullable) {function}

Source:
  • method/complement.js, line 16

Returns a new function that is the complement of predicate function predicate

Example
const isNegative = x => (x < 0)
const isNonNegative = complement(isNegative)
isNonNegative(1) // true
Parameters:
Name Type Description
predicate function
Returns:

the complement of predicate, if it's a function, otherwise null

Type
function

(static) debounce(func, wait, immediate) → {void}

Source:
  • method/debounce.js, line 22

Limits the amount of calls to a function over time

Examples
debounce(myFunction)
// Calls myFunction after the default 250 ms
debounce(myFunction, 500)
// Calls myFunction after 500 ms
debounce(myFunction, 500, true)
// Calls myFunction immediately
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

function to call
wait Number

how long to wait between function calls
immediate Boolean

should call immediately
Returns:
Type
void

(static) doIt() → {void}

Source:
  • method/doIt.js, line 19

Execute a method n times.
Callback params - does not include number || callback method

Examples
doIt(10, window, [], (index, arr) => { arr.push(index) }) === [ 0,1,2 ... 8,9 ]
doIt(10, () => console.log(`Hello`)) // Logs `Hello` 10 times
Parameters:
Name Type Description
args.0 Number

number of times to call the callback
args.1 parent

value to bind the method call to ( this )
args.last function

arg of args array - method to call
Returns:
Type
void

(static) eitherFunc(func1, func2) → {function}

Source:
  • method/eitherFunc.js, line 19

Returns the first param if it's a function.
If first param is not a function, returns second param.

Examples
eitherFunc(() => {}, 'bar')
// Returns first param because it's a function.
eitherFunc('foo', 'bar')
// Returns 'bar'
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func1 function

return if is func
func2 function

use if first is not an object
Returns:
Type
function

// Returns false

(static) limbo(promise, asObjectopt) → {Promise.<TLimboResponse>}

Source:
  • method/limbo.js, line 28

Adds catch to a promise for better error handling of await functions
Removes the need for wrapping await in a try / catch
First argument is an Error when the promise throws or null when it resolves
Second argument is the response from the resolved promise

Example
const [ err, data ] = await limbo(promiseFunction())
// returns an array
// * err will be undefined if no error was thrown
// * data will be the response from the promiseFunction
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
promise Promise.<function()>

Promise to be resolved
asObject boolean <optional>
 false

2nd argument in resp array should be an object when an error is caught
Returns:
  • Slot 1 => error, Slot 2 => response from promise
Type
Promise.<TLimboResponse>

(static) limboify(cb, args) → {Promise|*}

Source:
  • method/limbo.js, line 51

Converts a method with a callback as the last argument into a promise

Examples
limboify(fs.rename, 'my/file.txt', 'my/renamed-file.txt')
limboify(fs.mkdir, 'my/new/directory', { recursive: true })
Parameters:
Name Type Description
cb *

method to wrap in a promise
args *

Arguments to pass to the callback method
Returns:
  • Success response of fs.rename method
Type
Promise | *

(static) match(matchArg, entries) → {*}

Source:
  • method/match.js, line 51

Pattern matching function. Iterates through the entries,
which have the form [ check value or predicate, return value ], and
when it encounters an entry whose check value matches the matchArg
(or the predicate returns true when passed the matchArg), it returns
the return value of that entry.

For the default case: use [ match.default, ]

Examples
const value = 1
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
 [ match.default, "defaulted"]
)
=> returns "hello"
const value = 3
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
)
=> returns "greater"
// react reducer:
function todoReducer(state, action) {
  const reducer = match(action.type,
      [ 'ADD-TODO', addTodo ],
      [ 'REMOVE-TODO', removeTodo ],
      [ 'UPDATE-TODO', updateTodo ],
      [ match.default, state ]
  )

  return reducer(state, action)
}
Parameters:
Name Type Description
matchArg *

the argument to match against the cases
entries Array

the cases to match against the matchArg
Returns:
  • the return value of the first entry with a matching check value, else null
Type
*

(static) memorize(func, getCacheKey) → {function}

Source:
  • method/memorize.js, line 19

Creates a method to memorize passed in methods output

Examples
memorize(myFunction, cacheKeyFunction)
memorize(myFunction, cacheKeyFunction, 100)
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

method to memorize output of
getCacheKey function

gets the key to save cached output
Returns:

memorized function with cache

Type
function

(static) noOp() → {void}

Source:
  • method/noOp.js, line 8

Reusable empty function that is a no-op

Returns:
Type
void

(static) not(func) → {function}

Source:
  • method/not.js, line 56

When called, it calls original function, then returns inverse of the functions result
Should be used with functions that return a boolean

Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

Function call and invert its response
Returns:
  • Calls the passed in function then returns True if the passed in function returns falsy, otherwise false
Type
function

(static) parseErrorMessage(exception) → (nullable) {string}

Source:
  • method/parseErrorMessage.js, line 20

Extracts the message from the exception, whether string or object

Example
try {
  throwSomeException()
}
catch (err) {
  const message = parseErrorMessage(err) || 'Error'
}
Parameters:
Name Type Description
exception *

Error to be extracted
Returns:
  • The message or null if no message is present
Type
string

(static) pipeline(item, …functions) → {*}

Source:
  • method/pipeline.js, line 16

Function for making repeated nested function calls (the 'pipeline') succinct. Passes "item" into
the first function (as its first argument), takes its result and passes that into the next function, and repeats.
Continues until no functions remain, at which point it returns the value returned by the last function.
- you can also pass in an array in place of a function to specify a function to be called with some arguments. E.g.: [foo, 2, 3] would return foo(item, 2, 3)

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
item *

the starting input. If it is a function, it will be executed immediately and the result will be piped into the remaining functions.
functions function <repeatable>

Functions to be iterated over one after the other
Returns:
  • the final result of calling the pipeline of functions , starting with item as input
Type
*

(static) runSeq(asyncFns) → {Promise.<Array.<*>>}

Source:
  • method/runSeq.js, line 29

Calls each promise-returning function in array asyncFns, but awaits each before calling the next. Will pass the index and resolved values of complete functions to each subsequent function, in case any need them.

Examples
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions)
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions, { cloneResults: true, returnOriginal: false })
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
asyncFns Array.<function()>

array of functions to call in sequence. Each will be passed (currentIndex, resultsSoFar)
options.cloneResults boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 false

if true, each function will be passed a deep clone of the results array, rather than the reference to it.
options.returnOriginal boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 true

if true, any member of asyncFns that is not a function will have its corresponding value in the return array be itself. If this is false, that value will be undefined.
Returns:
  • returns a promise that resolves to an array of all the asyncFns' return values
Type
Promise.<Array.<*>>

      [ 'ADD-TODO', addTodo ],

(static) pipeline(item, …functions) → {*}

Source:
  • method/pipeline.js, line 16

Function for making repeated nested function calls (the 'pipeline') succinct. Passes "item" into
the first function (as its first argument), takes its result and passes that into the next function, and repeats.
Continues until no functions remain, at which point it returns the value returned by the last function.
- you can also pass in an array in place of a function to specify a function to be called with some arguments. E.g.: [foo, 2, 3] would return foo(item, 2, 3)

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
item *

the starting input. If it is a function, it will be executed immediately and the result will be piped into the remaining functions.
functions function <repeatable>

Functions to be iterated over one after the other
Returns:
  • the final result of calling the pipeline of functions , starting with item as input
Type
*

(static) runSeq(asyncFns) → {Promise.<Array.<*>>}

Source:
  • method/runSeq.js, line 29

Calls each promise-returning function in array asyncFns, but awaits each before calling the next. Will pass the index and resolved values of complete functions to each subsequent function, in case any need them.

Examples
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions)
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions, { cloneResults: true, returnOriginal: false })
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
asyncFns Array.<function()>

array of functions to call in sequence. Each will be passed (currentIndex, resultsSoFar)
options.cloneResults boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 false

if true, each function will be passed a deep clone of the results array, rather than the reference to it.
options.returnOriginal boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 true

if true, any member of asyncFns that is not a function will have its corresponding value in the return array be itself. If this is false, that value will be undefined.
Returns:
  • returns a promise that resolves to an array of all the asyncFns' return values
Type
Promise.<Array.<*>>

(static) stackTracePaths(filter) → {Array.<string>}

Source:
  • method/stackTracePaths.js, line 14

Gets the paths from a stacktrace as CallSites and returns them

Parameters:
Name Type Description
filter Array | function

List of paths to ignore, or function that returns truthy to ignore
Returns:
  • List of paths from the stackTrace
Type
Array.<string>

(static) throttle(func, waitopt) → {function}

Source:
  • method/throttle.js, line 12

Throttle function calls to only execute once over a wait period

Example
throttle(() => console.log('throttled'), 50)()
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
func *

method to call after wait
wait Number <optional>
 100

time to wait between calls
Returns:

throttled function

Type
function

(static) throttleLast(func, cb, waitopt) → {function}

Source:
  • method/throttleLast.js, line 19

Ensures the last call to the throttled function get called.
Will wait the allotted time, before calling the last call to it.
The final call will not execute until no more calls are made,
Accepts a callback to call each time the throttle called,

Example
throttleLast(() => {}, () => {})()
// throttle function
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
func function

method to call after wait
cb function

method to call after throttle function is called
wait Number <optional>
 100

time to wait until executing func param
Returns:

throttled function

Type
function

(static) throwError(error)

Source:
  • method/throwError.js, line 12

Throws an Error from the passed in error

Parameters:
Name Type Description
error Object | string

The Error message or Object to throw
Throws:

Error

(static) timedRun(fn, …argsnullable) → {Promise.<Array.<*, number>>}

Source:
  • method/timedRun.js, line 17

Executes and times the function fn.

Examples
const [ result, executionTime ] = timedRun(() => http.get(url)))
const [ result, executionTime ] = timedRun(http.get, url)
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
fn function
args * <nullable>
<repeatable>

any number of arguments to pass to fn when it is called
Returns:

[ fn output, execution time in ms ]

Type
Promise.<Array.<*, number>>

(static) uuid(startopt) → {String}

Source:
  • method/uuid.js, line 12

Creates a uuid, unique up to around 20 million iterations.

Example
uuid()
// New uuid as a string
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
start Number <optional>

of the uuid
Returns:
  • build uuid
Type
String

(static) waitForIt() → {Promise.<any>}

Source:
  • method/waitForIt.js, line 33

Waits for check method to return true before calling onFinish
Will call the passed in checkMethod x (amount) number of times before failing
Will wait x ( wait ) milliseconds between calls to the check method

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
args.check function

checks if onFinished should be called ( returns true )
args.onFinish function

called when check methods returns true
args.amount Number <optional>
 4

Amount of times to call the check before failing
args.wait Number <optional>
 1000

Time to wait between each check
...args Array <optional>

Arguments to pass to the check, and onFinish methods
Returns:
  • Resolves to the response from onFinish
Type
Promise.<any>

Methods

(static) applyToFunc(item, expression)

Source:
  • method/applyToFunc.js, line 13

Helper for pipeline. Passes 'item' into 'expression' as its first argument.
Expression may be a function or an array of form: [function, ...remainingArguments].

Parameters:
Name Type Description
item *
expression *

(static) checkCall(method, params) → {*}

Source:
  • method/checkCall.js, line 15

Check if the passed in method is a function, and calls it

Example
checkCall((param1) => { return param1 }, 'foo')
// Returns 'foo'
Parameters:
Name Type Description
method function

function to call
params Object

params to pass to the method on call
Returns:
  • whatever the passed in method returns
Type
*

(static) cloneFunc(func) → {Object}

Source:
  • method/cloneFunc.js, line 16

Clones a function using the Function constructor and calling toString on the passed in function

Example
const func = () => { console.log('test') }
const clone = cloneFunc(func)
// clone !== func
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

function to clone
Returns:

cloned function

Type
Object

(static) compareTo(x, y) → {number|null}

Source:
  • method/compareTo.js, line 14

Generic compare to method that works for strings, numbers, and booleans

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x string | number | boolean
y string | number | boolean
Returns:
  • returns a value < 0 if x is less than y, 0 if they are equal, and a value greater than 0 if x is greater than y. Returns null if the args are not comparable.
Type
number | null

(static) complement(predicate) → (nullable) {function}

Source:
  • method/complement.js, line 16

Returns a new function that is the complement of predicate function predicate

Example
const isNegative = x => (x < 0)
const isNonNegative = complement(isNegative)
isNonNegative(1) // true
Parameters:
Name Type Description
predicate function
Returns:

the complement of predicate, if it's a function, otherwise null

Type
function

(static) debounce(func, wait, immediate) → {void}

Source:
  • method/debounce.js, line 22

Limits the amount of calls to a function over time

Examples
debounce(myFunction)
// Calls myFunction after the default 250 ms
debounce(myFunction, 500)
// Calls myFunction after 500 ms
debounce(myFunction, 500, true)
// Calls myFunction immediately
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

function to call
wait Number

how long to wait between function calls
immediate Boolean

should call immediately
Returns:
Type
void

(static) doIt() → {void}

Source:
  • method/doIt.js, line 19

Execute a method n times.
Callback params - does not include number || callback method

Examples
doIt(10, window, [], (index, arr) => { arr.push(index) }) === [ 0,1,2 ... 8,9 ]
doIt(10, () => console.log(`Hello`)) // Logs `Hello` 10 times
Parameters:
Name Type Description
args.0 Number

number of times to call the callback
args.1 parent

value to bind the method call to ( this )
args.last function

arg of args array - method to call
Returns:
Type
void

(static) eitherFunc(func1, func2) → {function}

Source:
  • method/eitherFunc.js, line 19

Returns the first param if it's a function.
If first param is not a function, returns second param.

Examples
eitherFunc(() => {}, 'bar')
// Returns first param because it's a function.
eitherFunc('foo', 'bar')
// Returns 'bar'
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func1 function

return if is func
func2 function

use if first is not an object
Returns:
Type
function

(static) identity(x) → {*}

Source:
  • method/identity.js, line 9

A function that simply returns its input

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x *
Returns:

the input

Type
*

(static) isFunc(test) → {Boolean}

Source:
  • method/isFunc.js, line 15

Check if the passed in item is a function.

Examples
isFunc(() => {})
// Returns true
isFunc('bar')
// Returns false
Parameters:
Name Type Description
test *
Returns:

is a function

Type
Boolean

(static) isOrderable(x) → {bool}

Source:
  • method/isOrderable.js, line 13

Checks if param is an orderable primitive

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x *
Returns:
  • true if x is a comparable primitive
Type
bool

(static) limbo(promise, asObjectopt) → {Promise.<TLimboResponse>}

Source:
  • method/limbo.js, line 28

Adds catch to a promise for better error handling of await functions
Removes the need for wrapping await in a try / catch
First argument is an Error when the promise throws or null when it resolves
Second argument is the response from the resolved promise

Example
const [ err, data ] = await limbo(promiseFunction())
// returns an array
// * err will be undefined if no error was thrown
// * data will be the response from the promiseFunction
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
promise Promise.<function()>

Promise to be resolved
asObject boolean <optional>
 false

2nd argument in resp array should be an object when an error is caught
Returns:
  • Slot 1 => error, Slot 2 => response from promise
Type
Promise.<TLimboResponse>

(static) limboify(cb, args) → {Promise|*}

Source:
  • method/limbo.js, line 51

Converts a method with a callback as the last argument into a promise

Examples
limboify(fs.rename, 'my/file.txt', 'my/renamed-file.txt')
limboify(fs.mkdir, 'my/new/directory', { recursive: true })
Parameters:
Name Type Description
cb *

method to wrap in a promise
args *

Arguments to pass to the callback method
Returns:
  • Success response of fs.rename method
Type
Promise | *

(static) match(matchArg, entries) → {*}

Source:
  • method/match.js, line 51

Pattern matching function. Iterates through the entries,
which have the form [ check value or predicate, return value ], and
when it encounters an entry whose check value matches the matchArg
(or the predicate returns true when passed the matchArg), it returns
the return value of that entry.

For the default case: use [ match.default, ]

Examples
const value = 1
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
 [ match.default, "defaulted"]
)
=> returns "hello"
const value = 3
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
)
=> returns "greater"
// react reducer:
function todoReducer(state, action) {
  const reducer = match(action.type,
      [ 'ADD-TODO', addTodo ],
      [ 'REMOVE-TODO', removeTodo ],
      [ 'UPDATE-TODO', updateTodo ],
      [ match.default, state ]
  )

  return reducer(state, action)
}
Parameters:
Name Type Description
matchArg *

the argument to match against the cases
entries Array

the cases to match against the matchArg
Returns:
  • the return value of the first entry with a matching check value, else null
Type
*

(static) memorize(func, getCacheKey) → {function}

Source:
  • method/memorize.js, line 19

Creates a method to memorize passed in methods output

Examples
memorize(myFunction, cacheKeyFunction)
memorize(myFunction, cacheKeyFunction, 100)
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

method to memorize output of
getCacheKey function

gets the key to save cached output
Returns:

memorized function with cache

Type
function

(static) noOp() → {void}

Source:
  • method/noOp.js, line 8

Reusable empty function that is a no-op

Returns:
Type
void

(static) not(func) → {function}

Source:
  • method/not.js, line 56

When called, it calls original function, then returns inverse of the functions result
Should be used with functions that return a boolean

Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

Function call and invert its response
Returns:
  • Calls the passed in function then returns True if the passed in function returns falsy, otherwise false
Type
function

(static) parseErrorMessage(exception) → (nullable) {string}

Source:
  • method/parseErrorMessage.js, line 20

Extracts the message from the exception, whether string or object

Example
try {
  throwSomeException()
}
catch (err) {
  const message = parseErrorMessage(err) || 'Error'
}
Parameters:
Name Type Description
exception *

Error to be extracted
Returns:
  • The message or null if no message is present
Type
string

(static) pipeline(item, …functions) → {*}

Source:
  • method/pipeline.js, line 16

Function for making repeated nested function calls (the 'pipeline') succinct. Passes "item" into
the first function (as its first argument), takes its result and passes that into the next function, and repeats.
Continues until no functions remain, at which point it returns the value returned by the last function.
- you can also pass in an array in place of a function to specify a function to be called with some arguments. E.g.: [foo, 2, 3] would return foo(item, 2, 3)

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
item *

the starting input. If it is a function, it will be executed immediately and the result will be piped into the remaining functions.
functions function <repeatable>

Functions to be iterated over one after the other
Returns:
  • the final result of calling the pipeline of functions , starting with item as input
Type
*

(static) runSeq(asyncFns) → {Promise.<Array.<*>>}

Source:
  • method/runSeq.js, line 29

Calls each promise-returning function in array asyncFns, but awaits each before calling the next. Will pass the index and resolved values of complete functions to each subsequent function, in case any need them.

Examples
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions)
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions, { cloneResults: true, returnOriginal: false })
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
asyncFns Array.<function()>

array of functions to call in sequence. Each will be passed (currentIndex, resultsSoFar)
options.cloneResults boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 false

if true, each function will be passed a deep clone of the results array, rather than the reference to it.
options.returnOriginal boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 true

if true, any member of asyncFns that is not a function will have its corresponding value in the return array be itself. If this is false, that value will be undefined.
Returns:
  • returns a promise that resolves to an array of all the asyncFns' return values
Type
Promise.<Array.<*>>

(static) stackTracePaths(filter) → {Array.<string>}

(static) match(matchArg, entries) → {*}

Source:
  • method/match.js, line 51

Pattern matching function. Iterates through the entries,
which have the form [ check value or predicate, return value ], and
when it encounters an entry whose check value matches the matchArg
(or the predicate returns true when passed the matchArg), it returns
the return value of that entry.

For the default case: use [ match.default, ]

Examples
const value = 1
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
 [ match.default, "defaulted"]
)
=> returns "hello"
const value = 3
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
)
=> returns "greater"
// react reducer:
function todoReducer(state, action) {
  const reducer = match(action.type,
      [ 'ADD-TODO', addTodo ],
      [ 'REMOVE-TODO', removeTodo ],
      [ 'UPDATE-TODO', updateTodo ],
      [ match.default, state ]
  )

  return reducer(state, action)
}

Name Type Description
matchArg *

the argument to match against the cases
entries Array

the cases to match against the matchArg
Returns:
  • the return value of the first entry with a matching check value, else null

(static) pipeline(item, …functions) → {*}

Source:
  • method/pipeline.js, line 16

Function for making repeated nested function calls (the 'pipeline') succinct. Passes "item" into
the first function (as its first argument), takes its result and passes that into the next function, and repeats.
Continues until no functions remain, at which point it returns the value returned by the last function.
- you can also pass in an array in place of a function to specify a function to be called with some arguments. E.g.: [foo, 2, 3] would return foo(item, 2, 3)

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
item *

the starting input. If it is a function, it will be executed immediately and the result will be piped into the remaining functions.
functions function <repeatable>

Functions to be iterated over one after the other
Returns:
  • the final result of calling the pipeline of functions , starting with item as input
Type
*

(static) runSeq(asyncFns) → {Promise.<Array.<*>>}

Source:
  • method/runSeq.js, line 29

Calls each promise-returning function in array asyncFns, but awaits each before calling the next. Will pass the index and resolved values of complete functions to each subsequent function, in case any need them.

Examples
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions)
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions, { cloneResults: true, returnOriginal: false })
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
asyncFns Array.<function()>

array of functions to call in sequence. Each will be passed (currentIndex, resultsSoFar)
options.cloneResults boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 false

if true, each function will be passed a deep clone of the results array, rather than the reference to it.
options.returnOriginal boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 true

if true, any member of asyncFns that is not a function will have its corresponding value in the return array be itself. If this is false, that value will be undefined.
Returns:
  • returns a promise that resolves to an array of all the asyncFns' return values
Type
Promise.<Array.<*>>

(static) stackTracePaths(filter) → {Array.<string>}

Source:
  • method/stackTracePaths.js, line 14

Gets the paths from a stacktrace as CallSites and returns them

Parameters:
Name Type Description
filter Array | function

List of paths to ignore, or function that returns truthy to ignore
Returns:
  • List of paths from the stackTrace
Type
Array.<string>

(static) throttle(func, waitopt) → {function}

Source:
  • method/throttle.js, line 12

Throttle function calls to only execute once over a wait period

Example
throttle(() => console.log('throttled'), 50)()
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
func *

method to call after wait
wait Number <optional>
 100

time to wait between calls
Returns:

throttled function

Type
function

(static) throttleLast(func, cb, waitopt) → {function}

Source:
  • method/throttleLast.js, line 19

Ensures the last call to the throttled function get called.
Will wait the allotted time, before calling the last call to it.
The final call will not execute until no more calls are made,
Accepts a callback to call each time the throttle called,

Example
throttleLast(() => {}, () => {})()
// throttle function
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
func function

method to call after wait
cb function

method to call after throttle function is called
wait Number <optional>
 100

time to wait until executing func param
Returns:

throttled function

Type
function

  • method/timedRun.js, line 17

Executes and times the function fn.

Examples

const [ result, executionTime ] = timedRun(http.get, url)
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
fn function
args * <nullable>
<repeatable>

any number of arguments to pass to fn when it is called
Returns:

[ fn output, execution time in ms ]

Type
Promise.<Array.<*, number>>

(static) waitForIt() → {Promise.<any>}

Source:
  • method/waitForIt.js, line 33

Waits for check method to return true before calling onFinish
Will call the passed in checkMethod x (amount) number of times before failing
Will wait x ( wait ) milliseconds between calls to the check method

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
args.check function

checks if onFinished should be called ( returns true )
args.onFinish function

called when check methods returns true
args.amount Number <optional>
 4

Amount of times to call the check before failing
args.wait Number <optional>
 1000

Time to wait between each check
...args Array <optional>

Arguments to pass to the check, and onFinish methods
Returns:
  • Resolves to the response from onFinish
Type
Promise.<any>

function to call
params Object

params to pass to the method on call

Clones a function using the Function constructor and calling toString on the passed in function

Example
const func = () => { console.log('test') }
const clone = cloneFunc(func)
// clone !== func
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

function to clone
Returns:

cloned function

(static) compareTo(x, y) → {number|null}

Source:
  • method/compareTo.js, line 14

Generic compare to method that works for strings, numbers, and booleans

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x string | number | boolean
y string | number | boolean
Returns:
  • returns a value < 0 if x is less than y, 0 if they are equal, and a value greater than 0 if x is greater than y. Returns null if the args are not comparable.
Type
number | null

(static) complement(predicate) → (nullable) {function}

Source:
  • method/complement.js, line 16

Returns a new function that is the complement of predicate function predicate

Example
const isNegative = x => (x < 0)
const isNonNegative = complement(isNegative)
isNonNegative(1) // true
Parameters:
Name Type Description
predicate function
Returns:

the complement of predicate, if it's a function, otherwise null

Type
function

(static) debounce(func, wait, immediate) → {void}

Source:
  • method/debounce.js, line 22

Limits the amount of calls to a function over time

Examples
debounce(myFunction)
// Calls myFunction after the default 250 ms
debounce(myFunction, 500)
// Calls myFunction after 500 ms
debounce(myFunction, 500, true)
// Calls myFunction immediately
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

function to call
wait Number

how long to wait between function calls
immediate Boolean

should call immediately
Returns:
Type
void

(static) doIt() → {void}

Source:
  • method/doIt.js, line 19

Execute a method n times.
Callback params - does not include number || callback method

Examples
doIt(10, window, [], (index, arr) => { arr.push(index) }) === [ 0,1,2 ... 8,9 ]
doIt(10, () => console.log(`Hello`)) // Logs `Hello` 10 times
Parameters:
Name Type Description
args.0 Number

number of times to call the callback
args.1 parent

value to bind the method call to ( this )
args.last function

arg of args array - method to call
Returns:
Type
void

(static) eitherFunc(func1, func2) → {function}

Source:
  • method/eitherFunc.js, line 19

Returns the first param if it's a function.
If first param is not a function, returns second param.

Examples
eitherFunc(() => {}, 'bar')
// Returns first param because it's a function.
eitherFunc('foo', 'bar')
// Returns 'bar'
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func1 function

return if is func
func2 function

use if first is not an object
Returns:
Type
function

(static) limbo(promise, asObjectopt) → {Promise.<TLimboResponse>}

Source:
  • method/limbo.js, line 28

Adds catch to a promise for better error handling of await functions
Removes the need for wrapping await in a try / catch
First argument is an Error when the promise throws or null when it resolves
Second argument is the response from the resolved promise

Example
const [ err, data ] = await limbo(promiseFunction())
// returns an array
// * err will be undefined if no error was thrown
// * data will be the response from the promiseFunction
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
promise Promise.<function()>

Promise to be resolved
asObject boolean <optional>
 false

2nd argument in resp array should be an object when an error is caught
Returns:
  • Slot 1 => error, Slot 2 => response from promise
Type
Promise.<TLimboResponse>

(static) limboify(cb, args) → {Promise|*}

Source:
  • method/limbo.js, line 51

Converts a method with a callback as the last argument into a promise

Examples
limboify(fs.rename, 'my/file.txt', 'my/renamed-file.txt')
limboify(fs.mkdir, 'my/new/directory', { recursive: true })
Parameters:
Name Type Description
cb *

method to wrap in a promise
args *

Arguments to pass to the callback method
Returns:
  • Success response of fs.rename method
Type
Promise | *

(static) match(matchArg, entries) → {*}

Source:
  • method/match.js, line 51

Pattern matching function. Iterates through the entries,
which have the form [ check value or predicate, return value ], and
when it encounters an entry whose check value matches the matchArg
(or the predicate returns true when passed the matchArg), it returns
the return value of that entry.

For the default case: use [ match.default, ]

Examples
const value = 1
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
 [ match.default, "defaulted"]
)
=> returns "hello"
const value = 3
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
)
=> returns "greater"
// react reducer:
function todoReducer(state, action) {
  const reducer = match(action.type,
      [ 'ADD-TODO', addTodo ],
      [ 'REMOVE-TODO', removeTodo ],
      [ 'UPDATE-TODO', updateTodo ],
      [ match.default, state ]
  )

  return reducer(state, action)
}
Parameters:
Name Type Description
matchArg *

the argument to match against the cases
entries Array

the cases to match against the matchArg
Returns:
  • the return value of the first entry with a matching check value, else null
Type
*

(static) memorize(func, getCacheKey) → {function}

Source:
  • method/memorize.js, line 19

Creates a method to memorize passed in methods output

Examples
memorize(myFunction, cacheKeyFunction)
memorize(myFunction, cacheKeyFunction, 100)
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

method to memorize output of
getCacheKey function

gets the key to save cached output
Returns:

memorized function with cache

Type
function

(static) noOp() → {void}

Source:
  • method/noOp.js, line 8

Reusable empty function that is a no-op

Returns:
Type
void

(static) not(func) → {function}

Source:
  • method/not.js, line 56

When called, it calls original function, then returns inverse of the functions result
Should be used with functions that return a boolean

Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

Function call and invert its response
Returns:
  • Calls the passed in function then returns True if the passed in function returns falsy, otherwise false
Type
function

(static) parseErrorMessage(exception) → (nullable) {string}

Source:
  • method/parseErrorMessage.js, line 20

Extracts the message from the exception, whether string or object

Example
try {
  throwSomeException()
}
catch (err) {
  const message = parseErrorMessage(err) || 'Error'
}
Parameters:
Name Type Description
exception *

Error to be extracted
Returns:
  • The message or null if no message is present
Type
string

(static) pipeline(item, …functions) → {*}

Source:
  • method/pipeline.js, line 16

Function for making repeated nested function calls (the 'pipeline') succinct. Passes "item" into
the first function (as its first argument), takes its result and passes that into the next function, and repeats.
Continues until no functions remain, at which point it returns the value returned by the last function.
- you can also pass in an array in place of a function to specify a function to be called with some arguments. E.g.: [foo, 2, 3] would return foo(item, 2, 3)

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
item *

the starting input. If it is a function, it will be executed immediately and the result will be piped into the remaining functions.
functions function <repeatable>

Functions to be iterated over one after the other
Returns:
  • the final result of calling the pipeline of functions , starting with item as input
Type
*

(static) runSeq(asyncFns) → {Promise.<Array.<*>>}

Source:
  • method/runSeq.js, line 29

Calls each promise-returning function in array asyncFns, but awaits each before calling the next. Will pass the index and resolved values of complete functions to each subsequent function, in case any need them.

Examples
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions)
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions, { cloneResults: true, returnOriginal: false })
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
asyncFns Array.<function()>

array of functions to call in sequence. Each will be passed (currentIndex, resultsSoFar)
options.cloneResults boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 false

if true, each function will be passed a deep clone of the results array, rather than the reference to it.
options.returnOriginal boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 true

if true, any member of asyncFns that is not a function will have its corresponding value in the return array be itself. If this is false, that value will be undefined.
Returns:
  • returns a promise that resolves to an array of all the asyncFns' return values
Type
Promise.<Array.<*>>

(static) stackTracePaths(filter) → {Array.<string>}

Source:
  • method/stackTracePaths.js, line 14

      [ 'ADD-TODO', addTodo ],

(static) pipeline(item, …functions) → {*}

Source:
  • method/pipeline.js, line 16

Function for making repeated nested function calls (the 'pipeline') succinct. Passes "item" into
the first function (as its first argument), takes its result and passes that into the next function, and repeats.
Continues until no functions remain, at which point it returns the value returned by the last function.
- you can also pass in an array in place of a function to specify a function to be called with some arguments. E.g.: [foo, 2, 3] would return foo(item, 2, 3)

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
item *

the starting input. If it is a function, it will be executed immediately and the result will be piped into the remaining functions.
functions function <repeatable>

Functions to be iterated over one after the other
Returns:
  • the final result of calling the pipeline of functions , starting with item as input
Type
*

(static) runSeq(asyncFns) → {Promise.<Array.<*>>}

Source:
  • method/runSeq.js, line 29

Calls each promise-returning function in array asyncFns, but awaits each before calling the next. Will pass the index and resolved values of complete functions to each subsequent function, in case any need them.

Examples
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions)
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions, { cloneResults: true, returnOriginal: false })
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
asyncFns Array.<function()>

array of functions to call in sequence. Each will be passed (currentIndex, resultsSoFar)
options.cloneResults boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 false

if true, each function will be passed a deep clone of the results array, rather than the reference to it.
options.returnOriginal boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 true

if true, any member of asyncFns that is not a function will have its corresponding value in the return array be itself. If this is false, that value will be undefined.
Returns:
  • returns a promise that resolves to an array of all the asyncFns' return values
Type
Promise.<Array.<*>>

(static) stackTracePaths(filter) → {Array.<string>}

Source:
  • method/stackTracePaths.js, line 14

Gets the paths from a stacktrace as CallSites and returns them

Parameters:
Name Type Description
filter Array | function

List of paths to ignore, or function that returns truthy to ignore
Returns:
  • List of paths from the stackTrace
Type
Array.<string>

(static) throttle(func, waitopt) → {function}

Source:
  • method/throttle.js, line 12

Throttle function calls to only execute once over a wait period

Example
throttle(() => console.log('throttled'), 50)()
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
func *

method to call after wait
wait Number <optional>
 100

time to wait between calls
Returns:

throttled function

Type
function

(static) throttleLast(func, cb, waitopt) → {function}

Source:
  • method/throttleLast.js, line 19

Ensures the last call to the throttled function get called.
Will wait the allotted time, before calling the last call to it.
The final call will not execute until no more calls are made,
Accepts a callback to call each time the throttle called,

Example
throttleLast(() => {}, () => {})()
// throttle function
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
func function

method to call after wait
cb function

method to call after throttle function is called
wait Number <optional>
 100

time to wait until executing func param
Returns:

throttled function

Type
function

  • method/timedRun.js, line 17

Executes and times the function fn.

Examples

const [ result, executionTime ] = timedRun(http.get, url)
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
fn function
args * <nullable>
<repeatable>

any number of arguments to pass to fn when it is called
Returns:

[ fn output, execution time in ms ]

Type
Promise.<Array.<*, number>>

(static) waitForIt() → {Promise.<any>}

Source:
  • method/waitForIt.js, line 33

Waits for check method to return true before calling onFinish
Will call the passed in checkMethod x (amount) number of times before failing
Will wait x ( wait ) milliseconds between calls to the check method

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
args.check function

checks if onFinished should be called ( returns true )
args.onFinish function

called when check methods returns true
args.amount Number <optional>
 4

Amount of times to call the check before failing
args.wait Number <optional>
 1000

Time to wait between each check
...args Array <optional>

Arguments to pass to the check, and onFinish methods
Returns:
  • Resolves to the response from onFinish
Type
Promise.<any>

function to call
params Object

params to pass to the method on call

Clones a function using the Function constructor and calling toString on the passed in function

Example
const func = () => { console.log('test') }
const clone = cloneFunc(func)
// clone !== func
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

function to clone
Returns:

cloned function

(static) compareTo(x, y) → {number|null}

Source:
  • method/compareTo.js, line 14

Generic compare to method that works for strings, numbers, and booleans

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x string | number | boolean
y string | number | boolean
Returns:
  • returns a value < 0 if x is less than y, 0 if they are equal, and a value greater than 0 if x is greater than y. Returns null if the args are not comparable.
Type
number | null

(static) complement(predicate) → (nullable) {function}

Source:
  • method/complement.js, line 16

Returns a new function that is the complement of predicate function predicate

Example
const isNegative = x => (x < 0)
const isNonNegative = complement(isNegative)
isNonNegative(1) // true
Parameters:
Name Type Description
predicate function
Returns:

the complement of predicate, if it's a function, otherwise null

Type
function

(static) debounce(func, wait, immediate) → {void}

Source:
  • method/debounce.js, line 22

Limits the amount of calls to a function over time

Examples
debounce(myFunction)
// Calls myFunction after the default 250 ms
debounce(myFunction, 500)
// Calls myFunction after 500 ms
debounce(myFunction, 500, true)
// Calls myFunction immediately
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

function to call
wait Number

how long to wait between function calls
immediate Boolean

should call immediately
Returns:
Type
void

(static) doIt() → {void}

Source:
  • method/doIt.js, line 19

Execute a method n times.
Callback params - does not include number || callback method

Examples
doIt(10, window, [], (index, arr) => { arr.push(index) }) === [ 0,1,2 ... 8,9 ]
doIt(10, () => console.log(`Hello`)) // Logs `Hello` 10 times
Parameters:
Name Type Description
args.0 Number

number of times to call the callback
args.1 parent

value to bind the method call to ( this )
args.last function

arg of args array - method to call
Returns:
Type
void

(static) eitherFunc(func1, func2) → {function}

Source:
  • method/eitherFunc.js, line 19

Returns the first param if it's a function.
If first param is not a function, returns second param.

Examples
eitherFunc(() => {}, 'bar')
// Returns first param because it's a function.
eitherFunc('foo', 'bar')
// Returns 'bar'
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func1 function

return if is func
func2 function

use if first is not an object
Returns:
Type
function

(static) limbo(promise, asObjectopt) → {Promise.<TLimboResponse>}

Source:
  • method/limbo.js, line 28

Adds catch to a promise for better error handling of await functions
Removes the need for wrapping await in a try / catch
First argument is an Error when the promise throws or null when it resolves
Second argument is the response from the resolved promise

Example
const [ err, data ] = await limbo(promiseFunction())
// returns an array
// * err will be undefined if no error was thrown
// * data will be the response from the promiseFunction
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
promise Promise.<function()>

Promise to be resolved
asObject boolean <optional>
 false

2nd argument in resp array should be an object when an error is caught
Returns:
  • Slot 1 => error, Slot 2 => response from promise
Type
Promise.<TLimboResponse>

(static) limboify(cb, args) → {Promise|*}

Source:
  • method/limbo.js, line 51

Converts a method with a callback as the last argument into a promise

Examples
limboify(fs.rename, 'my/file.txt', 'my/renamed-file.txt')
limboify(fs.mkdir, 'my/new/directory', { recursive: true })
Parameters:
Name Type Description
cb *

method to wrap in a promise
args *

Arguments to pass to the callback method
Returns:
  • Success response of fs.rename method
Type
Promise | *

(static) match(matchArg, entries) → {*}

Source:
  • method/match.js, line 51

Pattern matching function. Iterates through the entries,
which have the form [ check value or predicate, return value ], and
when it encounters an entry whose check value matches the matchArg
(or the predicate returns true when passed the matchArg), it returns
the return value of that entry.

For the default case: use [ match.default, ]

Examples
const value = 1
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
 [ match.default, "defaulted"]
)
=> returns "hello"
const value = 3
match(value,
 [ 1, "hello" ],
 [ x => x > 2, "greater" ]
)
=> returns "greater"
// react reducer:
function todoReducer(state, action) {
  const reducer = match(action.type,
      [ 'ADD-TODO', addTodo ],
      [ 'REMOVE-TODO', removeTodo ],
      [ 'UPDATE-TODO', updateTodo ],
      [ match.default, state ]
  )

  return reducer(state, action)
}
Parameters:
Name Type Description
matchArg *

the argument to match against the cases
entries Array

the cases to match against the matchArg
Returns:
  • the return value of the first entry with a matching check value, else null
Type
*

(static) memorize(func, getCacheKey) → {function}

Source:
  • method/memorize.js, line 19

Creates a method to memorize passed in methods output

Examples
memorize(myFunction, cacheKeyFunction)
memorize(myFunction, cacheKeyFunction, 100)
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

method to memorize output of
getCacheKey function

gets the key to save cached output
Returns:

memorized function with cache

Type
function

(static) noOp() → {void}

Source:
  • method/noOp.js, line 8

Reusable empty function that is a no-op

Returns:
Type
void

(static) not(func) → {function}

Source:
  • method/not.js, line 56

When called, it calls original function, then returns inverse of the functions result
Should be used with functions that return a boolean

Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

Function call and invert its response
Returns:
  • Calls the passed in function then returns True if the passed in function returns falsy, otherwise false
Type
function

(static) parseErrorMessage(exception) → (nullable) {string}

Source:
  • method/parseErrorMessage.js, line 20

Extracts the message from the exception, whether string or object

Example
try {
  throwSomeException()
}
catch (err) {
  const message = parseErrorMessage(err) || 'Error'
}
Parameters:
Name Type Description
exception *

Error to be extracted
Returns:
  • The message or null if no message is present
Type
string

(static) pipeline(item, …functions) → {*}

Source:
  • method/pipeline.js, line 16

Function for making repeated nested function calls (the 'pipeline') succinct. Passes "item" into
the first function (as its first argument), takes its result and passes that into the next function, and repeats.
Continues until no functions remain, at which point it returns the value returned by the last function.
- you can also pass in an array in place of a function to specify a function to be called with some arguments. E.g.: [foo, 2, 3] would return foo(item, 2, 3)

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
item *

the starting input. If it is a function, it will be executed immediately and the result will be piped into the remaining functions.
functions function <repeatable>

Functions to be iterated over one after the other
Returns:
  • the final result of calling the pipeline of functions , starting with item as input
Type
*

(static) runSeq(asyncFns) → {Promise.<Array.<*>>}

Source:
  • method/runSeq.js, line 29

Calls each promise-returning function in array asyncFns, but awaits each before calling the next. Will pass the index and resolved values of complete functions to each subsequent function, in case any need them.

Examples
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions)
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions, { cloneResults: true, returnOriginal: false })
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
asyncFns Array.<function()>

array of functions to call in sequence. Each will be passed (currentIndex, resultsSoFar)
options.cloneResults boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 false

if true, each function will be passed a deep clone of the results array, rather than the reference to it.
options.returnOriginal boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 true

if true, any member of asyncFns that is not a function will have its corresponding value in the return array be itself. If this is false, that value will be undefined.
Returns:
  • returns a promise that resolves to an array of all the asyncFns' return values
Type
Promise.<Array.<*>>

(static) stackTracePaths(filter) → {Array.<string>}

Source:
  • method/stackTracePaths.js, line 14

      [ 'ADD-TODO', addTodo ],

(static) pipeline(item, …functions) → {*}

Source:
  • method/pipeline.js, line 16

Function for making repeated nested function calls (the 'pipeline') succinct. Passes "item" into
the first function (as its first argument), takes its result and passes that into the next function, and repeats.
Continues until no functions remain, at which point it returns the value returned by the last function.
- you can also pass in an array in place of a function to specify a function to be called with some arguments. E.g.: [foo, 2, 3] would return foo(item, 2, 3)

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
item *

the starting input. If it is a function, it will be executed immediately and the result will be piped into the remaining functions.
functions function <repeatable>

Functions to be iterated over one after the other
Returns:
  • the final result of calling the pipeline of functions , starting with item as input
Type
*

(static) runSeq(asyncFns) → {Promise.<Array.<*>>}

Source:
  • method/runSeq.js, line 29

Calls each promise-returning function in array asyncFns, but awaits each before calling the next. Will pass the index and resolved values of complete functions to each subsequent function, in case any need them.

Examples
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions)
const results = await runSeq(asyncFunctions, { cloneResults: true, returnOriginal: false })
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
asyncFns Array.<function()>

array of functions to call in sequence. Each will be passed (currentIndex, resultsSoFar)
options.cloneResults boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 false

if true, each function will be passed a deep clone of the results array, rather than the reference to it.
options.returnOriginal boolean <optional>
<nullable>
 true

if true, any member of asyncFns that is not a function will have its corresponding value in the return array be itself. If this is false, that value will be undefined.
Returns:
  • returns a promise that resolves to an array of all the asyncFns' return values
Type
Promise.<Array.<*>>

(static) stackTracePaths(filter) → {Array.<string>}

Source:
  • method/stackTracePaths.js, line 14

Gets the paths from a stacktrace as CallSites and returns them

Parameters:
Name Type Description
filter Array | function

List of paths to ignore, or function that returns truthy to ignore
Returns:
  • List of paths from the stackTrace
Type
Array.<string>

(static) throttle(func, waitopt) → {function}

Source:
  • method/throttle.js, line 12

Throttle function calls to only execute once over a wait period

Example
throttle(() => console.log('throttled'), 50)()
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
func *

method to call after wait
wait Number <optional>
 100

time to wait between calls
Returns:

throttled function

Type
function

(static) throttleLast(func, cb, waitopt) → {function}

Source:
  • method/throttleLast.js, line 19

Ensures the last call to the throttled function get called.
Will wait the allotted time, before calling the last call to it.
The final call will not execute until no more calls are made,
Accepts a callback to call each time the throttle called,

Example
throttleLast(() => {}, () => {})()
// throttle function
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
func function

method to call after wait
cb function

method to call after throttle function is called
wait Number <optional>
 100

time to wait until executing func param
Returns:

throttled function

Type
function

  • method/timedRun.js, line 17

Executes and times the function fn.

Examples

const [ result, executionTime ] = timedRun(http.get, url)
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
fn function
args * <nullable>
<repeatable>

any number of arguments to pass to fn when it is called
Returns:

[ fn output, execution time in ms ]

Type
Promise.<Array.<*, number>>

(static) waitForIt() → {Promise.<any>}

Source:
  • method/waitForIt.js, line 33

Waits for check method to return true before calling onFinish
Will call the passed in checkMethod x (amount) number of times before failing
Will wait x ( wait ) milliseconds between calls to the check method

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
args.check function

checks if onFinished should be called ( returns true )
args.onFinish function

called when check methods returns true
args.amount Number <optional>
 4

Amount of times to call the check before failing
args.wait Number <optional>
 1000

Time to wait between each check
...args Array <optional>

Arguments to pass to the check, and onFinish methods
Returns:
  • Resolves to the response from onFinish
Type
Promise.<any>

function to call
params Object

params to pass to the method on call

Clones a function using the Function constructor and calling toString on the passed in function

Example
const func = () => { console.log('test') }
const clone = cloneFunc(func)
// clone !== func
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

function to clone
Returns:

cloned function

(static) compareTo(x, y) → {number|null}

Source:
  • method/compareTo.js, line 14

Generic compare to method that works for strings, numbers, and booleans

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x string | number | boolean
y string | number | boolean
Returns:
  • returns a value < 0 if x is less than y, 0 if they are equal, and a value greater than 0 if x is greater than y. Returns null if the args are not comparable.
Type
number | null

(static) complement(predicate) → (nullable) {function}

Source:
  • method/complement.js, line 16

Returns a new function that is the complement of predicate function predicate

Example
const isNegative = x => (x < 0)
const isNonNegative = complement(isNegative)
isNonNegative(1) // true
Parameters:
Name Type Description
predicate function
Returns:

the complement of predicate, if it's a function, otherwise null

Type
function

(static) debounce(func, wait, immediate) → {void}

Source:
  • method/debounce.js, line 22

Limits the amount of calls to a function over time

Examples
debounce(myFunction)
// Calls myFunction after the default 250 ms
debounce(myFunction, 500)
// Calls myFunction after 500 ms
debounce(myFunction, 500, true)
// Calls myFunction immediately
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func function

function to call
wait Number

how long to wait between function calls
immediate Boolean

should call immediately
Returns:
Type
void

(static) doIt() → {void}

Source:
  • method/doIt.js, line 19

Execute a method n times.
Callback params - does not include number || callback method

Examples
doIt(10, window, [], (index, arr) => { arr.push(index) }) === [ 0,1,2 ... 8,9 ]
doIt(10, () => console.log(`Hello`)) // Logs `Hello` 10 times
Parameters:
Name Type Description
args.0 Number

number of times to call the callback
args.1 parent

value to bind the method call to ( this )
args.last function

arg of args array - method to call
Returns:
Type
void

(static) eitherFunc(func1, func2) → {function}

Source:
  • method/eitherFunc.js, line 19

Returns the first param if it's a function.
If first param is not a function, returns second param.

Examples
eitherFunc(() => {}, 'bar')
// Returns first param because it's a function.
eitherFunc('foo', 'bar')
// Returns 'bar'
Parameters:
Name Type Description
func1 function

return if is func
func2 function

use if first is not an object
Returns:
Type
function
